Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities

The Optics Section provides world-leading capability and expertise in a wide range of technologies that are essential to the development of optical instruments. Section leadership and expertise are specifically applied to the development of advanced ground and space-based optical systems in the following areas: research and development of optics-related technologies; system architecture and concept definition; detailed optical system design, opto-mechanical design, analysis, and implementation; optical hardware integration and alignment, test and calibration of optical instruments and systems.

We invite you to join the Optics Section to serve as an Optical Engineer III. You will be reporting administratively to the Group Supervisor of the High Contrast Imaging Group. This group specializes in the development of coronagraphic imaging systems and exoplanet detection technologies including deformable mirrors, coronagraphs, starshades, high-resolution spectrometers, astrometric systems, and modeling of these systems.

We seek an Optical Engineer III to 1) operate and further advance coronagraph technologies on the High Contrast Imaging Testbed (HCIT); 2) support the planning and operation of Nancy Grace Roman Coronagraph Instrument (CGI) planning and operations for enhanced contrast goal modes; 3) support studies of coronagraphs for the Habitable Worlds Observatory Concept; and 4) support development of ground-based instrumentation including fiber-fed high-contrast spectrometry and extreme precision radial velocity instrumentation through collaboration with groups at Caltech.

Tasks will include but not be limited to:

  • Operating HCIT in support of SAT proposals and directed work.
  • Alignment, characterization, and upgrades to HCIT components, subsystems, and vacuum facilities.
  • Analyze CGI test data to predict HWO performance.
  • Optical systems engineering including error budgeting and sensitivity analyses for high contrast systems and RV instruments.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Optics, Optical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Applied Physics, or related technical field with typically a minimum of 6 years of hands-on hardware experience; Master’s degree in similar fields with a minimum of 4 years of related experience; or Ph.D. with an minimum of 2 years of experience in an area related to optical engineering and/or physics.
  • Hands-on experience and practical advanced knowledge in hardware integration, optical alignment, state-of-the-art measurement techniques
  • Expertise in image calibration and background subtraction.
  • Expertise in high-contrast imaging techniques
  • Extensive understanding of fundamental principles, theories, and concepts with applications to optical instrumentation

Preferred skills:

  • Experience with astronomical observations
  • Experience with fiber optics
  • Experience with deformable mirrors
  • Experience with Python, MATLAB, or LabView languages

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
